name: Analytical Engine
creator: Ada Lovelace
historicalContext: First conceptual programming language - never implemented but laid foundation for all future programming
description: The first conceptual programming language, created by Ada Lovelace for Charles Babbage's Analytical Engine. While never implemented, it established fundamental programming concepts.

name: FORTRAN
creator: John Backus (IBM)
helloWorld:
PROGRAM HELLO
WRITE(*,*) 'Hello, World!'
END PROGRAM HELLO
historicalContext: First high-level programming language, designed for scientific computing on IBM mainframes
description: The first high-level programming language, revolutionizing scientific computing and establishing the foundation for modern programming languages.

name: COBOL
creator: Grace Hopper & Committee
helloWorld:
IDENTIFICATION DIVISION.
PROGRAM-ID. HELLO.
PROCEDURE DIVISION.
DISPLAY 'Hello, World!'.
STOP RUN.
historicalContext: Designed for business applications, emphasizing readability and English-like syntax
description: The first business-oriented programming language, designed to be readable by non-programmers and handle large-scale data processing.

name: LISP
creator: John McCarthy (MIT)
historicalContext: First functional programming language, designed for artificial intelligence research
description: The first functional programming language, pioneering concepts that would influence modern languages and AI research.

name: ALGOL
creator: International Committee
historicalContext: First internationally standardized language, establishing many programming language concepts still used today
description: The first internationally standardized programming language, establishing fundamental concepts like block structure and recursion.

name: C
creator: Dennis Ritchie (Bell Labs)
historicalContext: Created for Unix operating system development, became the foundation for systems programming
description: The most influential programming language in history, forming the foundation for operating systems and modern languages.

name: Pascal
creator: Niklaus Wirth
historicalContext: Designed for teaching programming, emphasizing structured programming principles
description: A language designed for teaching programming, emphasizing structured programming and strong typing principles.

name: Smalltalk
creator: Alan Kay (Xerox PARC)
historicalContext: First pure object-oriented language, pioneering GUI and modern OOP concepts
description: The first pure object-oriented programming language, pioneering concepts that would define modern software development.

name: C++
creator: Bjarne Stroustrup (Bell Labs)
historicalContext: Extension of C with object-oriented features, became the standard for systems and application programming
description: The first widely adopted object-oriented language, extending C with classes and modern programming features.

name: Perl
creator: Larry Wall
historicalContext: Designed for text processing and system administration, became the 'duct tape of the internet'
description: The 'duct tape of the internet', revolutionizing text processing and web development in the early internet era.

name: Python
creator: Guido van Rossum
historicalContext: Designed for readability and simplicity, became the most popular language for data science and AI
description: A language designed for readability and simplicity, becoming the most popular language for data science and AI.

name: Java
creator: James Gosling (Sun Microsystems)
historicalContext: Created for embedded systems, became the dominant language for enterprise and web applications
description: The language that revolutionized enterprise computing with 'write once, run anywhere' philosophy.

name: JavaScript
creator: Brendan Eich (Netscape)
historicalContext: Created in 10 days for web browsers, became the most widely used programming language
description: The language that made the web interactive, created in just 10 days and now powering the modern internet.

name: PHP
creator: Rasmus Lerdorf
historicalContext: Created for personal home pages, became the backbone of early web development
description: The language that powered the early web, making dynamic websites accessible to millions of developers.

name: Ruby
creator: Yukihiro Matsumoto
historicalContext: Designed for programmer happiness, became popular for web development with Rails framework
description: A language designed for programmer happiness, revolutionizing web development with the Rails framework.

name: C#
creator: Microsoft
historicalContext: Microsoft's answer to Java, designed for the .NET platform and enterprise development
description: Microsoft's modern object-oriented language, designed for the .NET platform and enterprise development.

name: Go
creator: Google (Robert Griesemer, Rob Pike, Ken Thompson)
historicalContext: Created by Google to solve problems with C++ in large-scale systems, emphasizing simplicity and concurrency
description: Google's modern systems programming language, designed for simplicity, concurrency, and large-scale development.

name: Rust
creator: Mozilla (Graydon Hoare)
historicalContext: Created to solve memory safety issues in systems programming while maintaining performance
description: The language that solves memory safety without garbage collection, revolutionizing systems programming.

name: TypeScript
creator: Microsoft (Anders Hejlsberg)
historicalContext: JavaScript with static typing, solving the scalability problems of large JavaScript applications
description: JavaScript with static typing, solving the scalability problems of large web applications.

name: Swift
creator: Apple
historicalContext: Apple's modern language for iOS development, replacing Objective-C with better safety and performance
description: Apple's modern language for iOS development, combining safety, performance, and developer experience.

name: Kotlin
creator: JetBrains
historicalContext: Designed to be a better Java, became the preferred language for Android development
description: A modern language designed to be a better Java, now the preferred language for Android development.

name: Dart
creator: Google (Lars Bak, Kasper Lund)
historicalContext: Created by Google as a replacement for JavaScript, later became the foundation for Flutter mobile development
description: Google's language for building fast, multi-platform applications, powering the Flutter framework.

name: Julia
creator: MIT (Jeff Bezanson, Stefan Karpinski, Viral Shah, Alan Edelman)
historicalContext: Designed for high-performance scientific computing, combining the ease of Python with the speed of C
description: A high-performance language for scientific computing that combines ease of use with C-like speed.

name: Elixir
creator: Jos√© Valim
historicalContext: Built on the Erlang VM for fault-tolerant, distributed systems with Ruby-like syntax
description: A functional language built on the Erlang VM, combining fault-tolerance with developer-friendly syntax.

name: Scala
creator: Martin Odersky (EPFL)
historicalContext: Designed to address criticisms of Java while maintaining full interoperability with the JVM
description: A language that fuses object-oriented and functional programming on the JVM.

name: R
creator: Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman (University of Auckland)
historicalContext: Created for statistical computing and graphics, became the standard in academic and data science research
description: The language of statisticians and data scientists, designed specifically for data analysis and visualization.

name: Lua
creator: PUC-Rio (Roberto Ierusalimschy, Luiz Henrique de Figueiredo, Waldemar Celes)
historicalContext: Designed as an embeddable scripting language, became the standard for game scripting
description: A lightweight, embeddable scripting language that became the standard for game development scripting.

name: Objective-C
creator: Brad Cox and Tom Love (Stepstone)
historicalContext: Combined C with Smalltalk-style messaging, became the primary language for Apple platforms until Swift
description: The language that powered Apple's ecosystem for decades, combining C with Smalltalk's object model.

name: Assembly
creator: Various (First assemblers by Kathleen Booth, Maurice Wilkes)
helloWorld:
section .data
    msg db 'Hello, World!',0xa

section .text
    global _start

_start:
    mov eax, 4
    mov ebx, 1
    mov ecx, msg
    mov edx, 14
    int 0x80
historicalContext: The first step above machine code, providing human-readable mnemonics for processor instructions
description: The foundational low-level language that provides direct control over hardware with human-readable mnemonics.

name: BASIC
creator: John G. Kemeny and Thomas E. Kurtz (Dartmouth College)
historicalContext: Designed to enable non-science students to use computers, became the first language for a generation of programmers
description: The language that brought programming to the masses, enabling a generation to learn programming on home computers.

name: Erlang
creator: Ericsson (Joe Armstrong, Robert Virding, Mike Williams)
historicalContext: Created for telephony switches requiring extreme reliability and concurrent processing
description: The language built for telecom reliability, pioneering concurrent and fault-tolerant systems.

name: Haskell
creator: Haskell Committee (Simon Peyton Jones, Philip Wadler, et al.)
historicalContext: Created to consolidate functional programming research, became the standard for pure functional programming
description: The definitive pure functional programming language, influencing type systems across modern languages.

name: Clojure
creator: Rich Hickey
historicalContext: A modern Lisp for the JVM, designed for concurrent programming with immutable data structures
description: A modern Lisp dialect for the JVM, emphasizing immutability and concurrent programming.

name: F#
creator: Microsoft (Don Syme)
historicalContext: Microsoft's functional-first language for the .NET platform, bringing ML-style programming to enterprise
description: Microsoft's functional-first language bringing ML-style programming to the .NET ecosystem.

name: Groovy
creator: James Strachan
historicalContext: A dynamic language for the JVM designed to improve Java developer productivity
description: A dynamic language for the JVM that enhances Java with scripting capabilities and domain-specific languages.

name: Prolog
creator: Alain Colmerauer and Robert Kowalski
historicalContext: First major logic programming language, pioneered declarative AI programming
description: The pioneering logic programming language that influenced AI research and declarative programming.

name: Scheme
creator: Guy L. Steele and Gerald Jay Sussman (MIT)
historicalContext: A minimalist Lisp dialect designed for teaching programming concepts and language research
description: A minimalist Lisp dialect that influenced JavaScript and is widely used in computer science education.

name: OCaml
creator: INRIA (Xavier Leroy)
historicalContext: Extended ML with object-oriented features, used for critical software including finance and verification
description: A powerful ML-family language combining functional programming with practical object-oriented features.

name: Ada
creator: Jean Ichbiah (CII Honeywell Bull) for US DoD
historicalContext: Created for the US Department of Defense for mission-critical systems requiring extreme reliability
description: The language of safety-critical systems, designed for aerospace, defense, and transportation applications.

name: Zig
creator: Andrew Kelley
historicalContext: Modern systems language designed to replace C with better safety and developer experience
description: A modern systems language aiming to be a better C, with focus on simplicity and explicit behavior.
